intro: Ageratina vallincola, commonly known as the velvetleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely hairy, ovate leaves that are often a deep green color. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Ageratina vallincola is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
